System overview: A coastal drone network monitors pollution, shares data with maritime authorities, and triggers emergency response workflows.
Objectives: detect contamination, alert agencies, and coordinate cleanup resources.
Operating environment: saltwater exposure, high winds, and limited bandwidth links.
Actors: drone pilot, environmental analyst, and coast guard coordinator.
Interfaces: satellite link, onboard sensors, and incident management system.
Assumptions: drones can return to base within 30 minutes and authorities staff a 24/7 response desk.
